pkg/toolexec/executor.go.description: Executor implementation with synchronous Execute() method. Key patterns: timeout enforcement via context.WithTimeout, panic recovery with debug.Stack(), context error handling (DeadlineExceeded → TimeoutError, Canceled → ErrContextCancelled). Uses executorConfig for configuration (30s default timeout, maxConcurrent=1, recoverPanics=true). NewExecutor(nil) falls back to DefaultRegistry().

pkg/toolexec/middleware.go.description: Middleware system implementation with ToolFunc type, Middleware interface (Name() + Wrap()), MiddlewareChain for composition, and built-in middlewares (RecoveryMiddleware, TimingMiddleware, ContextCheckMiddleware, InputValidationMiddleware, LoggingMiddleware). DefaultMiddlewareChain() returns recommended defaults. Middlewares are applied in order: first added is outermost wrapper.

pkg/toolexec/options.go.description: Functional options pattern for Executor configuration. Key options: WithTimeout, WithMaxConcurrent, WithRecoverPanics, WithMiddleware, WithMiddlewareChain, WithDefaultMiddleware, WithUnlimitedConcurrency, WithNoTimeout. Also includes ExecutorConfig struct for inspecting config, DefaultExecutorOptions() for recommended defaults, and CombineOptions() for merging option slices. Pattern follows internal/api/client.go ClientOption style.

pkg/toolexec/*_test.go.description: Comprehensive unit tests for toolexec package. Three test files cover: registry_test.go (~500 lines) tests tool registration, discovery, thread-safety; executor_test.go (~945 lines) tests sync/async/batch execution, timeouts, panic recovery; middleware_test.go (~880 lines) tests middleware chaining, built-in middlewares. All follow table-driven test patterns from internal/api/client_test.go.

pkg/toolexec/example_test.go.description: Example tests for toolexec package demonstrating all major features: basic usage, registry operations, input/output, executor configuration, async/batch execution, middleware (built-in and custom), error handling, timeout/cancellation, and configuration inspection. Uses package toolexec_test for black-box testing with 16 Example functions following Go conventions.

pkg/toolexec/doc.go.description: Package-level documentation with comprehensive godoc covering: Overview, Quick Start, Architecture, Tool Interface, Registry, Executor, Middleware, Error Handling, Input/Output, Thread Safety, and Best Practices. Follows Go documentation conventions with code examples.
